inn1.comm: back of a length outside off and seaming away, Amla lets it go.
Amla is nicely behind the line this time as Malinga slings it in at 137 kph. Back of a length, true bounce and solid defence.

did we speak too soon about the carry? Malinga goes fuller this time, on leg and middle and gets the ball to curl away. Amla gets squared up, and outside edges it towards slip. It lands well short, sort of a soft edge.
Smith is away, Malinga straightens one from outside off as Smith leans across and steers it behind point for a couple.
another couple. Smith stays back and steers another short of length ball. This time it angled across him, and he guided it without a fuss.
short of a length again to end the over, not much room and Smith defends.
there you go, big inswing to start off. Amla covers the line and defends to the leg side.
back of a length and again a hint of inward movement. Amla defends to the off side.
beaten outside off. This one straightens after suggesting inward swing once again, and Amla goes for a hard-handed forcing shot. And misses.
gets it away this time with a sturdy outside edge as he plays from the crease. Single to third man.
good line for a right hander. Ends up on Smith's hips as he looks to tuck it behind square. It goes fine of the keeper for a leg bye.
Amla goes back and across, and works a length ball to the leg side.
Malinga straightens one down the line at 138 kph, defended to the leg side from the crease.
this one holds its line, Smith defends towards cover off the front foot.

hustles him with pace and carry. Smith shapes for an expansive cover punch from the back foot  - too ambitious, since Malinga is through him from a short of good length. The ball goes off the outside edge, wide of first slip.

got him this time! Malinga gets even more niggardly with the width this time, making Smith's choice of stroke look that much poorer. Once again, it bursts through from short of a length as Smith tries to force it to the off side. A thin edge this time, loops up at pace to the left of Sanga, who takes it superbly as he tumbles across. K' Naan blares on the PA system as Smith walks back. Are the SL fans waving their flags?
on the pads, nudged with the angle through square leg.
back of a length to Amla, who smoothly goes back and across to punch it into the covers.
short ball to Kallis, who stands tall and forces it down the track.
too much of that prodigious inward cut, it slips down the leg side and is called wide.
draws Kallis forward with a slightly fuller length. The ball seams in and it is defended off the front foot to the off side.
wider of off stump, doesn't come in sharply enough to make Kallis play. He lets it go through.
pitched up at 127 kph, Kallis needs no further invitation to press forward and drive into the covers. Top piece of timing, earns him three.
Amla generates ominous bat speed with a punch from the crease. Can't get the single behind square as he stands tall and forces the ball straight to the fielder.
the wrists open up, Amla carves the ball off the middle, but finds point again.
short of a length and shaping away from Kallis. He lets it go.
he's cranking it up, close to 140 kph now. Kallis stays behind the line and defends down the track.
this pitch is true, and will suit good batsmen as well as good bowlers. Kallis stands tall and punches Malinga's riser, straight to point.
throws in the slower ball at 122 kph, full and loopy. Kallis waits for it and defends.
Malinga tries to hustle Kallis, the un-hustlable. He waits for the ball to come beside him, and then leans back to chop it behind point for a single.
Amla stays back and defends down the track.
these two aren't getting beaten much, and are middling the ball without finding the placement. Full ball on off stump, Amla smokes it straight to mid-off.
that nipped in as Amla tried shuffling across. It bounced extra too, to hit his thigh.
he's throws everything after a wide ball outside off. It goes off the toe-edge towards third man.

Kallis' turn to shuffle across and get neatly inside the line. Once he did that, Kula's natural inward nip was negated, and the ball was asking to be whipped off the pads. Kallis obliged. The first ODI four of 2012 is here.
takes it outside off and keeps it short of a length. Kallis leaves.
Kallis again walks across and looks to shovel Kula with the angle. He doesn't middle it this time, and the ball dribbles away past short fine leg. Deep square leg has it covered, though.
trust Dilhara to catch you by surprise, all the time. He does a Harmison. Floats the ball a couple of miles down the leg side at 125 kph, and it runs away for five wides.

Nine runs have come off one legal Dilhara delivery! Short and wide this time, it was banged in in his half, and Amla banged it away with equal intent, standing tall and jumping as he cracked it square.
better, much better line. Cuts the angle on both sides of the stumps and Amla defends.
slower ball, Dilhara's first over has had everything. Amla waits for it as it holds and drops, and defends to mid-on.
quicker, and back of a length. Amla stays back and nudges to the leg side for a single.

well, you thought you'd seen everything in that over. Except for a high, juicy full toss on the hips. Dilhara obliges, and Kallis whips it behind square. Tharanga slides over the rope before pulling the ball in, so that's four.
back of a length outside off, Kallis calmly opens the face and dabs to third man.
ooh, banana swing for Kula, Kallis has to adjust after getting too far across to defend. He still deals with it well.
defends with bat and pad close together as Kula swings another one in.
opens the face and steers efficiently for a single towards third man.

he's gone through an ambitous Amla attempt at a cut. Well, he plays the shot quite well, so you can't fault him for that confidence. The ball was neither short enough, nor wide for the shot. And it came in off the seam. Amla shaped up for the cut, and missed.
goes wider this time, close to being called. Wide enough to make Amla let it go.
that cuts in, Amla tries to work it square and it hits the pad.
angled in from slightly wide of the crease. Not much pace, and that's how Angelo swings. Kallis defends off the front foot.
fuller length this time, Kallis leans out and defends to the off side.
whoa, Kallis jumps out and gets to the pitch of the ball. He drives fluently, but finds mid-off.
gets the single now, pushing a length ball into the covers.
Amla can't get this one away for runs.
ends with a probing full length ball at 124 kph. Amla defends cautiously
swings in from outside off, and it is defends to the leg side.
Kula swings it in again, Kallis' straight bat comes down decisively as he defends to the off side.
Kallis tries to skip inside the line and take him through the leg side, but Kula smartly shortens the length and keeps him quiet.

not so quiet this time! Kallis advances again, and this time Kula bowls a regulation length. The ball wafts into the slot and Kallis thumps it into the stands beyond long-on for the first six of the year.
shortens the length now, but Kallis doesn't advance this time. He opens the face and defends to the off side.
a wristy flourish on the flick gives Kallis a single through square leg.
back of a length on off stump, Kallis defends to the off side.
full length this time, Kallis defends off the front foot.
that stopped on Kallis, who worked it uppishly to mid-on who clumsily over-ran the ball. Only a single taken.
Amla opens the face and chops another length ball behind point.
Kallis tries to do likewise, steering with soft hands, but Angelo's lack of pace doesn't make it easy.
he gets the single away now, getting the ball very fine for a single.
gentle trundle at 122 kph, short and seaming away. Defended to the off side.
attacks the stumps this time, Kallis works it off the pads to the leg side.
that seamed away, almost surreptitiously, from a length. Kallis spots it, and pushes to the off side for one.
angled in, Amla works it off the pads through square leg for one.
Kallis gets a wide ball and steers serenely through backward point.
width again, not much pace from Kosala. Kallis guides to third man for a single.
Kallis pushes into the covers for a single.
nifty slower ball, Amla spots it and tries to launch it straight, but the ball comes too slowly for him to make connection.
short of a length outside off, Amla opens the face and defends to the off side.
gets the ball to swing away, Amla drives loosely and gets an outside edge, but there aren't any slips to worry him.
angled into the pads, worked with the angle through square leg.
too straight, Amla could have got a wide if he'd left it, but he flaps it towards backward square leg for one.
Amla gets width outside off and uses it to guide another single through backward point.
cuts the width to Kallis who skims it off the opened face through backward point for one more.
Amla's turn to dab. We have already seen more glides to third man in 2012 than we did last year. Ok, I made that up. Single to third man.
fuller length, Kallis leans out and drives to cover.
angled in at 128 kph, worked to mid-on firmly.
angled in, Kallis walks into the flick and gets a single through midwicket.
tossed up on the stumps, Kallis works it to the leg side. Very full, that.
holds the length back, Kallis works it with the turn through midwicket for a single.
short ball, holds the line outside off and Amla cuts for one.
looped up on middle and leg, and spinning further down. Kallis works it to the leg side.
flighted on the stumps, driven down the track and Dilly comes in the way to deny a single.
back of a length, Amla doesn't quite punish it. Hacked through the covers for a single.
starts off with a wide slower ball at 117 kph, and Amla throws the kitchen fittings at it. Scythed up and over off a generous outside edge, it spiralled menacingly before dropping short of third man.

shot of the year so far. (Ok, that's the last one. Really.) Pitched up on off stump, Kallis leans across and smokes it with robotic precision through the covers. Superb work from Tharanga running back, but four all the same as he puts it the slide and pull ball a moment too late.
angled into the pads now, Kallis clips behind square for a single. Dilhara bowls exactly the line you shouldn't when fine leg is in.
another slower ball, this was a nifty legcutter than leapt away at 124 kph. Kallis backs out of the cut shot.
the split finger, slow floating full toss slower ball now! Kallis does well to spot it in the air and defend cautiously.
pitched up this time, Kallis drills it right back and mid-on hurries across to cut it off. Drinks at Paarl.
Mendis crash lands into South Africa! Over the covers. Tossed up straight spinner on off stump, Amla opens up his stance and lofts him inside out for four.
straighter one again, outside off and Amla plays it to cover.
over-pitched on the pads, Amla clips to midwikcet.
full ball on off stump, a gimme single on offer with mid-off back. Amla takes it.
curled in on off stump, Kallis punches to Mendis' right and he fumbles to allow a single.
back of a length on the pads, Amla tucks it through square leg for a single.
another Dilhara slower ball, seemed to straighten down the line as Amla looked to drive down the ground. It goes off the outside edge to third man for runs.
back of a length outside off, Kallis opens the face and guides square.
another floated slower ball outside off that keeps whistling away out of Dilhara's fingers. Kallis drives down the wrong line now.
stays back and deflects a straight ball for another single through square.
length ball, Amla drives though he isn't to the pitch. Gets a single through cover.
angled into the pads, Kallis tucks through square leg for one.
Kallis takes another single through the leg side.

vintage Amla through the off side. Back of a length outside off and straightening to offer him just enough width. Amla stays put with a half step forward and unleashes the wrist to send it scooting through backward point. A touch of Mohammad Yousuf in that shot.
pitched up, Amla leans out to drive to mid-off.
over-cooked and sprayed down the leg side. Mendis not being allowed to settle here.

supreme from Amla. South Africa have 100. Tossed up on off stump, with several men patrolling the covers. Amla goes though them all with a spooned drive off an opened face. Class. He was struggling against the seamers, but he's tucking into Mendis' fare.
punches a single down the ground to end the over.
the fluency against spin might just aid him against seam too. Angled into the pads, and whipped efficiently for a single.

Sri Lanka miss a run out. Dilshan misses after moving to his left from point. Kallis opens the blade yet again and chops the ball into that area behind square where it becomes the non-striker's call. Kallis stop-started a few times, Amla was uncertain too and was not even in the frame. The throw missed.
short and wide, Amla literally climbs onto it with a flayed upper-cut. Deep point keeps him to one.
pushed towards point, can't get to his 50 yet.
85 ODI 50s for Kallis. Slower ball on the pads, he nurdles it to square leg for one.
Amla tries to work a soft single square, and plays it too softly. The ball rolls back, but not towards the stumps.
full length on off stump, Kallis threads the covers for a single. Amla v Mendis, again.
fires it in flat, Amla punches through the covers for a single.
Kallis tries to steer with the turn softly into the off side, but can't get the single away.
over-pitched on the stumps, Kallis drives through mid-off for one. The stand is worth 100.
slow and loopy, Amla waits and waits and drives it back to Mendis.
gets another single into the covers with a firm push to a full length ball.
Dilhara produces another cutter, it jumps up at Amla who defends firmly.
stays in the crease and works with the angle to mid-on.
short ball, gets Amla to hop and defend to the off side.
yorker that homes in devilishly, but Amla jams down on it.

he's happily going airborne now. Slower ball pitched up bravely by Dilhara, Amla drills it through the line with a power-loft. If he was deceived by the lack of pace, it didn't show. He just went through with the deed.
looks to pull a short ball now, but can't quite get it away.

Huge moment! LBW appeal turned down, and Sri Lanka consider using their review. Will they? Yes they will. Malinga got that to straighten from a leg stump line, but was it doing enough? First replays suggest it didn't. Landed on leg and sliding down. Sri Lanka are out of reviews. A touch harsh, I'd say, to give the teams just one review per innings.
Malinga says hello to the blockhole for the first time today. Not much pace on it, and Kallis hauls it out and plays to the leg side.
another yorker, Malinga produces these at will. He has yorkers up his sleeve and in his pockets. Amla digs it out this time.
Amla has 50, this has been a curate's egg of an innings, but it's looking increasingly better. Full again from Malinga, Amla gets it down to fine leg for two.
another full ball, Amla mistimes the on drive towards midwicket.
another one on the toes to end the over, Amla keeps it out. Good over, this.
another legcutter from Dilhara, Kallis shows his surprise as it jumps up towards the splice. Defended to the off side.
angled into the pads, Kallis nurdles behind square for a single.
hurried into the pull with a short ball at close to 140 kph. Amla miscues to midwicket.
gets very good hold of this one. Another short ball from Dilhara, Amla doesn't pull this as much as Sehwag-heave it across the line wide of mid-on. The ball thundered over and away for four.
top shot followed by beaten outside off. Amla attempts a cheeky dab to the off side to a ball that was quick was back of a length. Misses the edge by a whisker.
full to end the over, Amla opens the face and steers through point.
another full ball, Kallis drives it past mid-on who's standing wider than usual, for a single.
another full delivery. Amla deflects it with an opened face towards points.
not quite a yorker this time, but still very full and wide of off stump. Amla's feet don't get across and he mistimes a laboured drive.
very low full toss at good pace. It ends up on the pads, and Amla whips it behind square.

it failed him there, alright. Kallis gets stuck into a length ball as he looks to launch it out of town. The ball wasn't too full, and Kallis ended up shovelling it off the inner half though he held the pose to show the full face of the bat. The ball runs over mid-on for four.
menacing, late swinging full toss that is designed for the lbw. Kallis gets the bat in the way.
length ball outside off, and Kallis promptly steals a single with the open-faced dab to point.
on the pads, worked with the angle behind square for a single.
nipped into the pads from wide of the crease, and Kallis tucks a single through square leg.
Kallis drives through the line with a forward press and gets a single into the covers.
short offcutter outside off, Kallis hacks it away square for one more.
Amla gets the umpteenth single of the day through third man with an angled-faced dab.
Malinga starts with a yorker on off stump and it is squeezed to third man for one.
high full toss that swung down the line, and Kallis inner-edges onto the pads.
stupendous yorkers these. Another one that scuds down towards the toes, and Kallis can't do anything with it but defend.
another near yorker, Kallis plays it down the track. Can't quite get under it.
Kallis, you beaut. Malinga gives him just enough width, and Kallis knew where the gap was. He pushed the front foot down instead of across and blasted it through the covers for four.
two class shots from Kallis have made a good over end up looking quite poor. Another drill through the the cover and mid-off gap as Malinga over-pitches. The ball streaks away in haste.
three fours in three balls! Amla's turn to ooze some class through those stunning wrists. Opens up in the crease and sends a length ball scattering behind point.
cuts the width and the length, Amla defends.
pitched up, Amla tries to heave him over the covers and nearly holes out to the man in the circle. Lands just short. The offensive is on ...
slower ball from Kula, the ball stops on Amla who miscues the loft but manages to clear mid-off. Kallis scoots back for the second. 150 is up.
low full toss, too low for Amla to take advantage. He defends to the off side.
another attempted yorker, no where near Malinga pace on it. Amla works it to mid-on for a single.
full and wide, Amla reaches out and gets his customary single behind point away.
pitched up, Kallis drives along the carpet for a single to mid-off.

poor running, Kallis is gone. South Africa have handed SL a new year gift. Short and wide of off stump, Amla chops it straight to Mahela in the covers and they set off for a single. Mahela could have had a go at either end, and chose to go at Kallis'. He wasn't even trying to get in, that's how far out he was. Dead-eye from Mahela, nails the stumps down from an awkward angle.
short ball to AB first up, he drops the wrists and lets it go to Sanga who fumbles. No run conceded, though.
fuller ball on the stumps, AB drives it down the track carefully.
angled onto the pads, AB works it with the wrists through square leg.
short of a length outside off, AB's turn now to dab a single behind point.
short of a length and angled into the pads, Amla nudges it square for a single.
did that carry to short cover? Pitched up to AB who drives in the air, and the fielder tumbles forward for the take. Looked like he couldn't get under it.
pitched up outside off, Amla drives solidly to mid-off.
tight yorker that follows Amla's legs and he dead bats to the leg side for one.
back of a length on off stump, AB tries to slap it away but mistimes it to mid-on. The Powerplay is going a little pear-shaped for SA, but they don't want another wicket here.
slow legcutter, well wide of off stump and called.
super slow yorker, Amla punches it down the ground for a single.

they can place as many men as they want in the covers, but South Africa are intent on finding the gaps there. Point, cover, extra cover, mid-off all watch as AB opens up his stance to a full length and carves it in the air through one of those gaps. Ominous.
finds an even bigger gap now - the one over their heads. Mathews' offcutter comes along gently and asks to be smashed. AB carts it over wide mid-off for four more.
slow bumper, AB mistimes the pull to midwicket inside the circle.
another dangerous single, but Chandimal misses the stumps.. AB pushes to mid-on and takes off, Chandimal hurls it down and hits Mathews hand. AB would have struggled to make it.

another slow bumper to end the over and the Powerplay. Amla presses it down through square leg for one. 35 came off the Powerplay. Time for drinks. Alex Winter will take over the commentary for the rest of the innings.
length ball on leg stump and flicked out to deep square leg
short and pulled around the corner
length ball outside off and guided down the third man
length again and driven up to mid off who's on the edge of the circle and they can take a sharp single
dragged down and pulled down to long leg again
slower ball outside off, waited for, and driven out to deep cover
driven through the covers
length and waited for, punched out to deep cover
pushed away with an angled face through cover again
shorter and pulled but only as far as the deep fieldsman
much fuller and driven down to long off
punched from the crease through cover
back of a length and driven down to long off for a very comfortable single

back of a length again, tried to be clipped into the leg side, edged into the pad, drops into the leg side and they race through for a run as the bowler tries to intervene and flick the ball onto the stumps, Amla well back
a lovely straight drive but long on comes round to field
short outside off stump, de Villiers up on his toes and dabbing down to third man
straighter and fuller and late cut to third man
clipped to midwicket off the front foot
tries to go straighter and de Villiers misses attempting to sweep very fine
cut to point of a bottom edge
waited for an punched down the ground to long on
a touch quicker and flicked to midwicket
now beats the outside edge from an attempted drive from a length ball that just drifts away
just outside off stump and late cut to third man
full on middle and leg, de Villiers tries to open up the offside and drives to mid off
powerfully pulled but straight to the fielder at deep square leg
straighter and slower and moved round the corner to long leg but there's an overthrow after a poor throw back to Sangakkara and no backing up
down the leg side, full, a brief cry for a catch but wide called
back of a length outside off and cut away with perfect timing past the point fielder to the boundary
slower ball on middle stump and turned down to long leg
full and driven out to deep cover
given a touch of room, slapped out to deep cover
flighted delivery, pushed carefully into the covers
full toss and smashed down the ground for four, poor ball
touched down the leg side, it runs fine and they take two
full outside off and de Villiers gets down on one knee and times a lofted drive over extra cover
length on leg stump and flicked down to long leg
fuller but again leg stump and a single to long leg
full, nearly right up in the block hole but Amla's seeing it very well and turns it out to deep square leg
great shot. de Villiers steps outside leg stump, opening up space to hit outside off and lashes it away through extra cover
straighter and fuller and flicked to midwicket
flick off the front foot past midwicket, deep square comes round and they take two
length and waited for and pulled out to deep midwicket
reverse sweep from off stump, not quite timed, more helped behind square down to the third man
sat back and punched to long on
punched down the ground once more
length on off stump and de Villiers steps away once more and lifts over extra cover. Beautiful batting
Oh dear. Now a full toss hammered to cow corner
angled to third man
length ball on leg stump and pushed into midwicket
poor ball down the leg side and a flying take from Sangakkara
back of a length, pulled off the front foot out to deep square leg
length ball pushed out through the covers
good full ball and dug out into the covers
wide of off stump and pushed off the back foot to the sweeper to take Amla to 99
that's the hundred. Amla's 9th in ODIs from 114 balls, great knock. Gets there with a flick down to long leg...
pushed out through square leg
gone and boy did Sri Lanka need a wicket. That's a fine delivery, full yorker right on the popping crease and too good for de Villiers whose leg stump gets disturbed.
left hander onto strike and a full ball dug out behind square
another yorker and well kept out by Amla
full ball and pushed to midwicket
low full toss and driven back to the bowler, a diving attempt from Malinga is put down low to his left, such a tough chance
pushed through square leg
full and nudged through square leg
full and a square drive past point
angled down to third man
short ball to finish and Morkel ducks
length ball on middle and leg and worked out through midwicket for a single
full ball and a lovely clean strike down the ground, there's no man back on that fence for some reason and it's four to long on
another powerful strike but this time straight out to the man on the offside fence
full down the legside and turned down to long leg
full and driven on the bounce back to the bowler who parries with the right hand put doesn't get enough on it to prevent a single
full and driven to long off
full on middle stump, the batsman across his stumps and turned to short fine leg
tucked into the leg side and they take an easy single
an excellent yorker goes past the bat and past the off stump, surprises Sangakkara who makes the save with the left hand but they scramble a bye
short and pulled but straight to short fine leg
a full slower ball and an attempted drive down the ground gets a bottom edge behind the stumps
short and hammered over square leg. This chap can hit a mean ball and that really was murdered
full and driven and an excellent save by mid off
full outside off and driven above
slapped down the ground to long on and excellent running by Amla brings two
full toss outside off and cut down to third man
full and dug out into the leg side
full toss outside off again but this time cut to deep point
stand and deliver. Open the front leg and heave over long on, a great strike that sails for six

have another go...but this time finds the man at long on. It was again an opening of the leg side by clearing the front leg but the connection was nowhere near what was required to clear the rope and a good catch to long on coming in off the rope and taking the catch low down

now Amla goes. A wide length ball tries to be cut but produces an edge to Sangakkara who tumbles away to his left to take a good catch. Amla didn't move his feet and had to reach a long wait out to try and take it. Sri Lanka are responding here but the hosts are still in a very strong position
full and quick and kept out coming forward
now a slower full ball and tucked to cover
a sharp single taken from a push to mid off whose on the edge of the circle. Sharp work from the fielder but the batsman is well in
flicked off the back foot to long on
waited for and cut away through the covers
length ball worked into the leg side wide of midwicket

out. It's a shocker, length ball on middle and chipped back to the bowler who bags an easy catch. It might have just gripped in the pitch as Duminy looked to play down the ground but either way a very average way to go
straight and blocked back to the bowler
defended on middle and off
full slower ball and blocked
this is wild and a huge wide down the leg side zips away for four
back on the spot and worked out through square leg
full ball outside off and an attempted guide to third man gets a bottom edge past the stumps
this is slower and tried to be worked from leg stump, strikes the pad
full and a mediocre push into the offside produces a play and miss and a brief appeal for caught at the wicket
full on leg stump and pushed out to deep square leg
half tracker and pulled out but straight to the fielder
legside and worked out to deep square leg
smeared down the ground from outside off stump to long off
nice shot, du Plessis makes room for himself with a step down the pitch and drives past extra cover
tries to step away now but only a punch back to the bowler
a reach forward and drive out to long off
slower ball on middle stump worked to long leg and good scrambling allows them a second as the throw is wild back to the bowler, nearly an overthrow
dragged it on. Malinga is so good at the death. Short ball outside off, tried to be late cut down to third man, he's early on it and a bottom edge diverts the ball into the base of off stump
full on middle stump, Steyn meets it on the full but doesn't catch it and drags it too midwicket
Petersen went for the paddle over short fine leg to a full ball and misses but they scramble through for a leg bye as the ball runs out into the offside
there's five for Malinga! A wonderful full yorker bang on off stump that reverses in slightly and beats Steyn's attempted drive. Perfect death bowling from Lasith Malinga, great to watch.
it was another lovely full ball and dug out into the offside for a single

inn2.comm: good length to start off from over the stumps. Tharanga stays on the crease and defends to the off side.

Tharanga bags a duck! South Africa have struck early. Angled across this time, there was enough room for a punch through point, but Tharanga didn't move the feet at all. He through his hands at it, and it skimmed off the outside edge and was dying on Duminy at gully, who tumbled forward and held brilliantly.
Angled across wide of the off stump at good lively pace, Sanga doesn't chase it first up.

Sanga's away with a gem of an off drive. As good as any shot we've seen today. Pitched up again, closer to Sanga's range and he gets into position with a solid front foot push. He then eases it on the rise through mid-off. Hardly wasted a calorie in executing that stroke.
beaten. Morne responds with an away seamer, that went away from a subtly shorter length than the previous ball. Sanga drives again, but this time down the wrong line.
lets the last one go through outside off stump to the keeper.
short of a length ball jags in towards Dilshan, cramping him up and he defends to the off side

what a start for Tsotsobe, this is a terrific delivery, Tsotsobe gets the ball to come in once more after pitching back of a length, once again Dilshan has no room to cut, he gloves the ball through to the keeper, and both Sri Lanka openers are gone for a duck now
shorter this time, and it doesn't come back towards Chandimal, who is content to leave it through to the keeper
length ball just outside off, inside-edged on to his boots
Chandimal isn't shy of going for his strokes, irrespective of the situations, Tsotsobe tests him with a bouncer, Chandimal goes for the hook but he doesn't connect
Tsotsobe grunts as he bowls the final ball of the over, on the pads, it is tucked towards midwicket but not wide enough of the fielder to take a single
Sanga gets behind the line and defends a short of length ball.
pitched up on the stumps, Sanga once again rolls into gear for the off drive. Plays it defensively this time.
short ball and gangling lift from Morne, sticking faithfully to the 7-2 lines. Sanga leaves.
another one on a length and taking off outside off. Sanga leaves.
short ball, gets it to climb onto Sanga, who struggles to play it down, but manages. Only just.
another one angles across, another leave. Back-to-back maidens there.
Lopsy angles one across, Chandimal goes for the expansive cover drive and inside edges ... It misses the stumps, but not by much.

Chandimal is dealing in inside edges here. Lopsy thuds it in back of a length and gets the ball to hurry onto Chandimal who jabs without getting across. Inside edges it wide of the furniture and it runs to fine leg for four.

Another inside edge! This time, not thick enough to escape the stumps. Chandimal has been blasted out and SL are wobbly as jelly here. Lopsy cut this one in big time off the seam. It landed on middle and off and came straight in, past a flowing straight drive. Chandimal's elbow was high, the bat swing straight, but his legs were no where. The ball sneaked through. Stumps splattered.
Lopsy welcomes him with another snorter, Mahela had to climb tall to keep it down.
wafted across well wide of off stump. Mahela leaves and it is called a wide.
short and pacy at 136 kph.. Looked much faster! Through Mahela in a jiffy as he looks to cut despite not having room. The ball is a-talking.
again goes for the cut, and Lopsy is again through him in a trice.
angled across Sanga again, he lets it go to the keeper.

ooh, angled across from leg to off, Sanga stays back and tries to work it to leg and he inside edges it onto his thigh. The ball rolls back agonisingly towards the stumps, in slow motion. And Sanga comes back in to stop it with his bat.
mid-on is one of two people on the leg side, and Sanga finds him with his punch.

we could have a rout on our hands. Morne has smoked Sanga out with a giraffe's periscope of a jaffa. Sanga thought he could ride that and upper cut over the cordon, but he was cramped for room and confounded by the bounce. The ball snapped past to take the edge and AB has another catch. Captaincy is a cakewalk for him at the moment.
short ball to welcome him. Angelo rides the bounce and defends.

Oh boy. What's the biggest margin of defeat in an ODI? Angelo is gone now. Another duck. Morne gets another ball to take off after hitting a short of length area. Angelo tried to hop and nudge it square, but the extra bounce meant it hit much higher on the bat and looped up into the leg side for an easy take.
Lopsy angles one across Mahela, who inner-edges the drive down the ground. Lopsy fields it.
uppish but safe. Mahela goes for a steer and ends up playing it in the air, just wide of point. SL get into double-figures.
bumper, Lopsy is looking every bit like a man who has a point to prove. Mahela weaves away sensibly as this buzzes past his head.
angled across, Mahela lets it go to the keeper.
fuller length, draws Mahela forward and he defends to the off side.
this one leaps across off he seam, Mahela lets it go.
angled in from a touch wide of the crease. Kosala defends down the track.
length ball on off stump, Kosala pokes to point and sets off for a single.
Mahela is solidly behind the line as he defends towards mid-on.
that swung late, too late to trouble Mahela. AB did well to get his gloves onto it.
back of a length, Mahela hangs back and chops it to point. Can't get it through the gap.
length ball on off stump, defended to the off side solidly. Two overs without a wicket. Sri Lanka are recovering rapidly.
Lopsy lands it on a length around off stump, Kosala defends to the off side.
back of a length on the middle and leg line. Kosala taps to the leg side for a single.
angled across again, Mahela shoulders arms.
he can't control the temptation to cut. There are several fielders in the off side inside the circle, waiting for an edge. Mahela finds point.

South Africa are into the tail. Mahela, as expected, falls to a loose shot into the off side. Not that he could have played these anywhere else. Short ball, angling across at a bustling pace, without offering the room for the full-blooded cut. Mahela tried to go over point, but ended up playing it straight into his hands. How much worse can this get? The lowest score in ODI history could be set today. What a way to start 2012 ...
full and angled across, Nuwan lets it go. Wise call.
starts with a wide down the leg side.
fuller and better line, Kosala defends it down the track. Doesn't look very convincing.
works one off the pads towards square leg for a single.
pitched up, and some fluency on display. Kosala leans across and drives into the covers for a couple.
Steyn responds with a bumper. Big pace on that, Kosala ducked under it in a hurry.
short of a length outside off, wide enough for an easy leave. Kosala did just that.
fuller length to end the over, Kosala handles it reasonably well. Steyn denied a wicket in his first over.
Lopy continues to loop them across the right handers. Nuwan shoulders arms.
back of a length on off stump, Nuwan stays on the crease and defends to the off side.
short again, there's been almost nothing to drive from Lopsy. Nuwan stays back and dabs it square.
short of a length on the hips, tucked through square leg for a single.
Lopsy gives SL some respite by over-stepping. Full ball played to the mid-on area. Free-hit to follow.
Take that! Sri Lanka sail into the 20s confidently as Nuwan backs away and top-edges an upper cut over the slips.
slower ball, Kula tries to launch it into space as he lashes across the line. Play and a miss. Lopsy murmurs something at him.
fullish length outside off, draws Kosala forward and gets him to steer through point for one.
short of a length, pushes Nuwan back in the crease and he defends down the track.
short and swift, the ball jumps up off a length and Nuwan weaves away.

And another one. Steyn is relieved to have a share of the spoils, as he hounds Nuwan out. Another short ball, another lifter, another hop and nudge attempt by a batsman. The ball kicks up just that little bit extra to rear up and rap the handle before landing in the hands of gully. Sri Lanka are in trouble 24/7.
Steyn says hello to his fellow tearaway, with a speedy bumper. Malinga dangles the periscope but ducks under. Should have been called a wide.
another short ball, touching 145 kph this time, and Malinga has a mosquito-swat at it and misses.
pitched up on off stump, draws Kosala to drive into the covers.
short ball to Kosala, he does well to get into position early and pull with control. But he keeps it down effectively.
another short ball, that's been the plan so far in this chase, if you could call it that. Kosala weaves out of the way.
short of a length on middle and leg, defended down the track.
Kosala presses a pull down, and gets it through midwicket this time. A couple more to the total. SL are inching towards 35.

and a firm punch through the covers now. Kosala is looking better and better. Short of a length, and steered off the back foot with control. That's a replay he won't mind showing his top-order colleagues after the game.
Malinga moves away, mindful of bodily harm, and guides a short ball outside off through backward point.
legcutter on the stumps, Malinga covers the line and defends down the track.
short of a length once more, Kosala opens the face and steers it to the off side carefully.
fuller length ball, draws Kosala forward and gets him driving to mid-off for a single.
another short ball. This is getting tedious now. Malinga gets away in a hurry. He won't mind having a bullet-proof jacket.
and again. Malinga sways out of the line. This time it is no-balled for height. I guess he called the previous one.
Slower ball to finish off. I am sure Malinga thought it was a free-hit, but it wasn't. He misses, and the ball misses the stumps too.
beats the outside edge with his first ball. That seamed away, this man is really good when he has a little bit of assistance. The sun is going down, and there is some nip in the air.
uppish, but safe. Albie again gets the ball to seam away, and Kosala pushes with hard hands and it loops towards Faf at point. He hurls down the stumps at the bowler's end, but Malinga is in.
this time he gets it to bend in. Kosala had no clue what it was doing as he tried to defend away from the body. The ball snuck in through the gap, and missed off stump ...
short of a length outside off, defended from the crease to the off side. The fielder at cover throws unnecessarily and concedes an overthrow. Faf is the fielder again.
another across the line swat from Malinga to a short ball. Another miss.
follows him with a short ball, Malinga backs away and defends gingerly to the off side. Drinks in Paarl.
played forward into the offside
leg stump and played into the legside
full and driven down the ground to long off

gone and pathetic. A wild swipe across the line and Malinga is bowled in very ugly fashion. That was awful. He went down on one knee to try and slog sweep but got absolutely nowhere near a gentle turning leg ball which struck middle and off stumps half way up.
played forward the ball runs off the pad into the leg side
pushed into the offside from the front foot
given out lbw. It's been referred having struck the batsman quite high up the pad, looked straight enough. But it's missing the top of the bails by a decent distance.
length ball tries to be turned into the leg side, strikes the pad
full outside the off stump and guided to third man with a late cut dab
back of a length outside off stump and left alone
more of a length outside off and a bit of a dabble outside off but left alone just about
outside off again and it keeps quite low as the batsman plays inside the line
driven down the ground from a full length
pushed back to the bowler on off stump
length ball on middle stump and played forward
played off an inside edge behind square on the leg side
full and driven down the ground to long off
played forward on middle stump
length outside the off stump and a back foot dabble misses
length outside off stump and left alone
wide of off stump and cut and missed, good take from de Villiers low to his right
length ball and defended carefully from the crease out to point
nicely pulled, getting on top of the bounce, down to deep backward square
length ball on off stump and defended from the crease into the offside

big swing into the legside from a length ball misses, cry for leg before turned down referred. But hawk-eye has the ball hitting the batsman just outside the offstump - umpire's call it says. Enough doubt for me
full toss struck down the ground, mistimed
full ball and driven down the ground
pushed into the offside
sliding into the pads, flicked to short fine leg
an attempted lofted drive after a step down the pitch, comes off an inside edge into the legside
a step into the legside and cut away to third man from a length ball
back foot drive attempted with no foot movement and an inside edge runs down to long leg
length ball outside the off stump left alone
back of a length and defended into the leg side

caught on the boundary. Hook stroke, not in control, and it presents a simple chance to deep square leg who goes a few yards to his right and pouches with two hands. Couldn't get on top of the stroke and now this group of players are seriously in danger of creating history of the wrong kind...
back of a length outside off stump and dart and a miss, brief cry for caught behind from the bowler

length ball on middle and leg, strikes the pad and it's given out. There's a referral but this looks good, striking the batsman half-way up front pad, he was playing down the wrong line, and it's striking leg stump on the full
